column2: shira46, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am on the generic for this drug.  After 3 months of use, the eye pressure has lowered to within normal range. No big problems with side effects after the first couple of weeks. The main reason I am doing this review is because I am feeling ripped off and maybe I can save somebody else from the same experience.  A 3 pack of the generic at a major drugstore chain cost me $255 (no health insurance but I was willing to pay that when the other option was blindness...)  And now I am due for a refill.  I remembered my eye doctor telling me that Costco had good prices on it so I called them yesterday.  The lady said their price was $24.99!  I couldn't believe it, asked her to repeat it a couple of times, then called another Costco just to be sure and got the same answer. Yeah, this is sounding like a Costco add so I assure you I am in no way affiliated with that company.  I am fortunate that I haven't had to take a lot of prescriptions in my life so maybe everybody else knows to shop around, but if not, learn from my $200 plus mistake.

column2: voyageur65, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The combination of Xalatan and Timolol had disastrous side effects, characterized by redness, blurring, sensitivety to sunlight,and corneal pain when blinking.In other words, over medication! Episodes lasted a week or more. Timolol alone was effective without any of these side effects.

column2: deb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: No side effects. Pressure was 32, now down to 16. I have been taking it for over 2 years.  Recently was switched to generic due to group insurance coverage. The generic is NOT working for me.

column2: Carrie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Had been on Xalatan since Jan. 2007.  In April, 2011, switched to generic.  Have been getting sinus headaches and back-of-neck pain, almost daily since April.  Altho Drs have diagnosed sinus problems, two rounds of antibiotics and nasal steroid spray don't help.  Pain is not debilitating, but aspirin or other OTC pain meds don't relieve pain.  Reading reviews of others makes me wonder if the generic X and I just don't agree.  Pressure headaches also.  Change to generic is only major change in my life since then.  Any thoughts from others?

column2: KL, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I only used the generic version of this drug (latanoprost) 3 times. Each time I put it in, about an hour later I got a stiffening feeling around my eyes and down the area near my nose to my lips. The muscles quivered, lips felt slightly numb. 3rd night my heart started racing. But these symptoms went away in about an hour. Today, around noon, 12 hours after the last dose, I started sweating, got very red in the face, my heart raced, the muscles not only in my face but in my thighs started quivering, also around my eyes. Symptoms seemed to fade, but then came back. Called the doctor who prescribed it and my general eye dr. The latter told me to take benadryl, immediately. On the way to get it my tongue started feeling swollen and swallowing was starting to be obstructed. I took the pill right in the drug store and that stopped the worst of it after about an hour. Told to continue taking the benadryl until totally normal. which (11pm) is not yet. If you are taking this, or any of its sisters or cousins, keep benadryl and/or an epi pen by your side until you find out if you are okay on it. And don't ignore any symptoms, no matter how slight they seem. This turned on me really quickly and I didn't know what it was. Never had an allergic reaction like this before. Nothing about these symptoms mentioned in the enclosed literature or in the formal information on line. It may be a fine medication if you can tolerate it, but they really should warn about this kind of reaction.

column2: zalantan opht, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i feel a lot better while on that  treatment i don't feel that heavyness in my eye anymoresome

column2: Mary Dillard, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Xalatan worked to reduced my pressure to 15 and 18. It was only 18 and 20, but was told I had glaucoma and should reduce the pressure. The side effects were not too bad. Now I am taking the generic, Latanaprost. I have experienced all the side effects others describe and my doctor thinks I need an additional drug, Brimonidine to reduce my pressure even more. It has double the side effects. I have stopped using it. What should the eye pressure be for a person with glaucoma?

column2: donaldrodgers2@aol.com
yoyo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is the second time I have tried xalatan.  The first time I lasted about a month this time I am a week into it and I think I am going to have to stop it again, my body hurts my muscles ake and I feel sick all the time.  I keep telling myself that it will go away after awhile, but I dont know how long I can keep feeling this way.

column2: Joan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have low pressure glaucoma (13/14) and while the Xalatan reduced it to 9/9 in both eyes, I have experienced so much joint and muscle pain that I've had to sleep w/my cell phone within reach for 6 months in the event I can't get up one morning! (This is definitely making my arthritis & fibromyalgia much, much worse.) The hair growth is not just in the eye lashes, but all over the face! The dizziness, headaches and constant feeling that sand is in your eyes is secondary to the joint pain.

column2: weezer, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
cobra, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: eye pain,chest pain,joint pain,floaters, cloudy gray vision,film on eyes,eyelids felt like tissue paper,tear ducts hurt,dry eye, mood swings (rage,depression,thought I was going blind),stomach flaky,BAD DRUG,stopped drop after 12 days, took 48hrs. plus to get better.Tear ducts still moving out rocks.Vision has gotten better.Almost back to normal.

column2: DJ, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Xalatan has been completely effective in keeping my increased eye pressure down with no noticeable side effects for the past 5 years. I live in Spain and my national health plan covers most of the cost (I pay the equivalent of $10 a month for Xalatan), so the cost has not been an issue for me. I'm sure that there are many, many people like me, whose experience with this drug has been totally satisfactory. Unfortunately, most of us only comment about medications and treatments when they have not worked for us.

column2: sue, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: my husband has been on this drug for about 5 months now, seems to be effective in lowering the pressure in his eyes but the side effects have become almost unbearable for him, he wakes up with his eyes matted shut, his eyes and surrounding areas have become so red and swollen they have even bled.  eyes are itchy, watery, always look like he is crying, his doctor is thinking about stopping the medication, I do not think this drug is for everyone!!

column2: Bill, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Am a glaucoma suspect. Reduced IOP from 25 to 16. No side effects whatsoever. I keep in fridge and enjoy the cool feeling in eyes when administering. Love the stuff.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pressure in both eyes was 30 and within two weeks of using Xalatan, went to 15.  No bad experiences yet except a little burning when putting drops in.  Been on it for about 5 months and major issue is cost for that little bottle. Works good so far.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been using Xalatan for 9 months, one drop in each eye before bed.  It has lowered my IOP as desired (it was near-normal before, but was prescribed due to signs of open angle glaucoma).  I've experienced no side-effects at all other than occasional minor stinging when I put the drops in.

column2: rickgpr, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Discovered that my eye pressure was 23 in both eyes.  Doc started me on Xalatan.  After one month of use, eye pressure dropped to 13 in both eyes.  I have been using the drops for 3 months and have had no side effects.

column2: ms heck, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter is 14 yrs old and we just found out that she has Glaucoma. Its been very scary for all of us. Her pressure was 28 in one eye and 22 in the other, After being on Xalatan for 3 mos her went down to 15 in both. The only concern I have right now is her telling me she is having chest pain. I didn't know that that is a side effect until I ready this sight. I think this is cause to take the back to the Doctors. will give up on her soon.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried Xalatan, Istalol and now will be trying Alphagan P.  The Xalatan lowered my eye pressure, but caused me to have severe headaches and pain behind my eyes.  The same with the Istalol, plus it caused my blood sugar levels to increase.  Upon stopping both of these drops, the side effects went away.  Concerned about the Alphagan P because of possible interactions with other meds I have to take, but will give it a try.  It is so discouraging to have to keep doing this trial and error method of finding the right meds for my eyes.

column2: Ernie3, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this medication for about 1 month and have had no side effects. I have, however, found that it interferes with the blood thinning medication Warfarin.(Generic for Coumadin). Within a 2 week time period my blood thickness (Protime) went from a 3.1 to a 1.7. I contacted my heart doctor and he said Xalatan was the reason why. I have an appointment next week and I will learn more and update. If you are on any type of blood thinner, you should contact your doctor before using Xalatan drops.

column2: carol297@epix.net, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: WOW, after reading other's comments, I now think I know why I have such horrendous headaches..........and joint pain -- who knew??  These reviews are what people need to read when taking any drugs !!  I had great success with the drug dropping my pressure from 21/19 (borderline) to 13/13 BUT I don't know that I will keep taking if this is what's causing my pain.  I'll call dr asap.  Without reading these, I would NEVER have put 2 and 2 together.  I take anti-inflammatory drugs and just couldn't figure out where this pain in my lower neck was coming from all of a sudden.  But it makes since because I get the pain first thing when I wake up and it gets better as the day goes on.  I'm feeling fine tonight so think I'll skip it just one night and then see if the pain is there in the morning.  AND THE EXPENSE !!  I've been told Tolmoptic works just as well and is much cheaper per my pharmacist..........told my eye dr this but "yada yada yada", "new drugs" are always best !!  Well, if I'm taking it because it is borderline AND the other drug that has caused the Glaucoma may be stopped, I think I need to check further into other drugs !!

column2: Di, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug caused severe joint and muscle pain anywhere there was inflammation in my body.  This a prostaglandin, a substance known to cause inflammation and pain normally in the body.  DO NOT USE THIS DRUG!

column2: -, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
nurse2010, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication a little over 1 year. I am 62 years old.I have complained to my eye doctor aboutthe pink eye symptoms, he gave me more eye drops to combat those sytoms and basically said liv e with it. But this week at work as a nurse, I began with sudden onset, debilitating and painful hip joint pain.It required steroids, percocet and xray When the xray was negative, I looked at other causes. Very little is written in the sideeffects regarding joint pains, but this blog from users has confirmed suspicions. Mydoctor has changed the prescription but doubts this medicine is the cause. I personally know that my 82 y/o mother figured this out on her own when she suddenly could not move her shoulderBecause she is old, no one wanted to listen.!!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 6 weeks of use, eye pressure has decreased from 19-14.  Was apprehensive at first due to the many possible side effects, but have not experienced a single one as of yet, just very mild stinging upon instilling a drop at bedtime, lasts a minute or less...  very happy with this medication.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: So many side affects for me I felt like I was losing what sight I have left. Pay attention to what your body is saying to you! Upon getting RX was told there were virtually no side affects to this medication. I trusted the Dr. and started and continued to use for 4-5 months. Noticed several changes over the months but didn't contribute to medication at first. Finally when I was so sensitive to light it felt like I was trying to focus through wax paper I stopped using and all symptoms disappeared within days. Eyes still somewhat sensitive to light but continue to improve. Dr. had told me to stay on them but I refused to. I'm feeling much better and my sight is getting back to "normal" for me.

column2: carly, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The drug does its job, but I waste half of it trying to get it in my eye. The pharmacy did not have one of those crutches that I once used with xalatan. Would like to know where to obtain one.

column2: xalatan, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: side effects chest pain,dizziness.pains in legs,sickness. Feeling nauseous

column2: Diane, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The medication did help to lower the pressure in my eyes after taking it for 3 weeks but the side affects where not worth it. My vision became very blurry , eyes very light sensitive(blue eyes) burning and very red. looked like I was crying all the time. Called dr. and was told to stop them and am waiting for my new eye drops to arrive.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Great results, after 4 months of regular usage of xalatan the preasure of my eyes decrease noticeable.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Small bottle dispenses medication in large drops sometimes and sometimes very little. Too expensive to waste! Does an excellent job of controlling eye pressure!

column2: Barbara728, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: The pressure in my eyes has gone down considerably.  It is a little difficult to get the drop in the eye, and I sometimes miss!  Leaves a "burning" feeling for several seconds, but now lasting.  I am extremely grateful that my doctor prescribed it for me.  The alternative is decreased eyesight, and maybe blindness so no matter what reactions I may have it is preferable to what could happen!  (And yes, my eyelashes are a bit darker, fuller and longer...and that's not a bad thing!)

column2: Honeydip74, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I haven't had any side effects with Xalatan. Although I think I've noticed my eye lashes getting longer or their being more of them, but I'm not sure. My pressure went from about 25 to 15. I ended up having to get another medication to get my pressure down further but overall I'd say Xalatan was very effective. I think it can be difficult to get the drop in just right considering the size of the bottle and the fact you have to hold your bottom eyelid open. But once you get whatever technique down that's comfortable for you, it's fairly easy to use. Just be careful not to waste any drops because the bottle doesn't include much extra for mishaps.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Constant redness in eyes.

column2: catpat, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After six days of using Xalatan, my eyes became extremely bloodshot,swollen, my eye lids are painful, dripping fluid and having my eyelids stuck together when I wake up in the morning. I can barely see out of my right eye. The left eye is not as effected.I do not intend to continue using this product.

column2: AHill, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Been on drops since I was 15.  Thankfully they caught my high pressure early!  First it was Timoptic for a couple years and now Xalatan for around 10 years.  Reduced pressure from 32/33 to 18/19.  No known side effects for me.

column2: carrie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 2ND DAY ON XALATAN,noticed a raised red itchy hive on my left cheekbone area under the eye.I didnt think anything of it at the time. TODAY,3RD DAY, eyes not at red this morning. but i notice a raised itchy hive on my right cheekbone area under the eye.noticed this was  9;30 am, it seems to have gone down now. its 2;05. eyes not red at all anymore.

column2: carriee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ive been on this medicine for only 2 days.I wanted to journal my side effects to  this drug because prior to taking it,I read so many adverse reactions to it that it really scared me , to the point of callingmy doctor. So I want to give someone else another pattern of reaction experience to draw from. Im on vacation this week, so thats the reason for the late bedtimes.day 1)- drops put in at 11;15 pm. i didnt got to bed immediately, stayed up playing on computer till about  12;30am.felt some itching.next morning , 7;45am,-eyesballs very red(bloodshot). less by 2pm, by 4pm , no red.day 2)put drops in 11;17 pm. some itching.went to bed  12;45am.next morning  8;30,-eyesballs slightly red, but nowhere near as red as yesterday.Havent noticed any change in eyecolor. ( my eyes are blue, doc told me they may turn green, thats fine with me)day3 )--will report back tomorrow.

column2: bib, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Having used other eye drops such as travtan and lumigen xaltan seems to work the best for me although my pressure is still borderline because of thin corneas.

column2: maryjane, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it reduced pressure in eyes but the side effects finally got where i had to quit using after only 1 1/2 months, sore throat, floaters,severe joint pain,cloudy vision,feeling tired and upset stomach,

column2: QuickRick, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started Xalatan 2 days before going to Orlando - what a disaster.  I have arthritis in my hips.  The ache was incredible.  At first I didn't realize it could be the eye drops.  After about a week I stopped taking them (found out from my sister that joint pain was one of the side effects).  Two days later I was fine.  My wife is still angry that we didn't get to see any of the attractions.  Now have new doctor who said it wasn't very effective anyhow (24/24 to 21/21).  Now taking Alphagan P for about a week, so far so good.Also Note THIS: My sister's prescription from 2004 says it aggravates joint pain.  Her current 2009 prescription has NO MENTION of the joint pain issue!

column2: Audrey, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Xalatan is the best!! You use it once a day compared to others. As far as expense goes, I order the generic on line. It's the only way I can afford it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My glaucoma was detected early and I was advised to go on Xalatan to prevent later damage.  After about six weeks I developed nausea and migraine like headaches.  It seemed to change my glasses prescription and made it hard for me to adjust to new glasses.  These sort of side effects seem uncommon but I have seen them listed elsewhere.

column2: daisy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I do experience dry itching eyes, but at my eye doctors suggestion, I use Refresh Tears eye drops and this really helps. I also notice darkening skin on my eyelids and under my eye, but I don't mind this, because my glaucoma is under control and I can see!

column2: 22texas, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used Xalatan for at least five years since I was told I had glaucoma.  It has kept my pressure down and has had no side effects.  I am happy with the drug.

column2: Nick, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was using Lumigan before and it was quiet effecive in decreasing my eye pressure but after three years my doctor told me that Lumigan and Xalatan are very much same and I need to use xalatan to avoid side effects of Lumigan. I found that Xalatan is giving me bad headache when I get up in morning. I also found out that my blood pressure remains elevated. I will discuss this issues with my doctor on my next visit.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my blood pressure is going up

column2: Fringefighter, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Xalatan decreased my ocular pressure from 31 to 15. Thats the great part. I had a strange pain that radiates from the center of my chest to the left side. The effect was bothersome while trying to go to sleep. I take the drops before I go to bed. My doctor told me to stop taking the drops for a week and see if the effect stops. the effect has stopped. I also had the effect of a strange almost flu like symptom with out getting sick. Its a shame because the drug works. I will have to try something else. Please do not stop taking your drops without talking to your Dr. first.

column2: sohengann, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have developed allergy after Xalatan application after two weeks on my left eye. The allergy was very bad when Xalatan and timolo were used on my right eye. The allergy has caused mild blurrness over my left cornea, but was severe blurrness on my right eye.  It takes 8 weeks before the blurrness is completely eradicated after i stop using both drops.  However, the pressure has come down from 21 to 16.  I have stopped using Xalatan because of the allergy.

column2: Jaxx - 67, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This medication is sooo... expensive.Fear of losing my eyesight is why I use this medication.  How soon will a generic be available?

column2: areaar, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: my only problem is discoloration of the eye lid, a red tinge on it that makes it appear as you have been crying.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has been very effective in dropping my pressure from 23-26 to 13-14 in both eyes. I only wish that the cost would be lower or a generic drop could be developed. It's cost for retirees living on fixed incomes is quite high.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used the med for at least 5 years & have not experienced any of the side effects that are described by other reviewers,

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
donnadancerdonna, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Women beware -I used Travatan (sister drug) for 3 weeks and found black hairs growing all over my face. Also my regular hair color is light brown, and found far longer hair on my fingers and arms/brown. The literature mentioned longer eye lashes would result from this drug, but I never expected this result. After much electrolysis and laser hair removal, I am getting back to normal.  Just be advised - I wish I had been.  Perhaps the drug manufacturer could revise this as a hair growth product!

column2: Just Me, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The literature & docs don't tell all the nasty details about side-effects for Xalatan & latanoprost. In a nutshell, some are: red, itchy eyes & lids; "greasy" feeling to eyes & eye area; pimples/acne; increased anxiety; hair loss; cholesterol deposits around lids/orbital area; blurry vision; "raccoon-eyes"--darkening around eyes & lids, chest pain, and more. Also, the bottle is very small and it is very hard to squeeze a full drop out of it.

column2: Xalatan Opht, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After taking this drug for 6 months I began experiencing muscle and joint pain. Not realizing it was the drug I continued for another 3 months until I began also having flu-like symtoms, blurred vision and then dizziness. This is a bad drug.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Xalatan has reduced pressure....but the side affects are extreme.I use them at bedtime and wake up with my eyelids glued shut,have extreme irritation and redness.I feel like I have sand in my eyes and worst of all my vision is so blurry I can't see to drive.My Dr. says I should stop complaining and be grateful that I have a drop that works.I am grateful !!! Thanks for letting me vent...best wishes to all

column2: lb, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: pressure went from 32 in both eyes down to mid-teens for last 7 years - recommend drug - only minimal side effects but better than vision loss - no change in vision field test since started taking medication

column2: huja, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Jo, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: after using xalatan for a short while--developed pain in muscles and joints--thinking it was inflamation -went on anti-inflamatory meds for 4 weeks -but pain became almost debilitating-- and developed flu symptoms-went off the xalatan and began to show improvement  but still have residual pain in one leg and back--will be doubly cautious of ANY med that even has a slight possiblity of causing joint or muscle pain

column2: edooley, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Much better than Cosoft--does not burn and I only have to use these drops once a day at bedtime....my pressure has remained low since using Xalatan.

column2: CJ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I actually love the side effects, I had long lashes already, now they are great!  No mascara!  And it looks like I have eye shadow on all the time without the hassle.Has kept my pressure down for 4 years now.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: When traveling keeping the medication cold is very difficult.  Especially with overseas travel.

column2: CindyAtHome2007@cs.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Although this drug is non-painful and easy to use, it does have side effects such as discoloration of your eyelids to a dark pink and it does cause eyelash growth. For me, this worsens a condition I have already with embedded eyelashes due to scar tissue on my eyelids from 30 years of battling this dreadful eye disease with caustic glaucoma drops. Also, the manufacturers of this drug only give you a small amount. If you are blind in one eye (like myself due to glaucoma), we don't always get the drop in the eye each time. I wish they would stop measuring the amounts out to the single drop dosage of 30 drops per month. Ridiculous!

column2: atswank, 55-64 (Patient)
column9: Within a few months of using this medicine, I started experiencing flu like symptoms. Think of the worst flu shakes you've ever had and triple that. I noticed it only happened at night after I used the drops and it lasted only 4 to 5 hours. I now take an allergy med once a day and have not had this side effect since I started taking it. My eye doctor said he had never heard of this, but my GP doctor felt I had a legitimate claim.

column2: Duke, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Pressure 42 right, 38 left, both in low twenties now. This drug may well have saved my vision. Zero side effects. Pricey, but how do you put a price on your sight?

column2: Ms. Quinlan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 2 months of using drugs, I had inflamation and pain every joint in my body.

column2: undertaker, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: 70 year old female.  After 2 years Xalatan has not diminished the light flashes in the corner of left eye.  Dr. too rushed to explain beginning administration.  Online reading warned me of potential danger to heart.  Should I use another drug and/or another doctor.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
justaguy, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Actually turned my hazel eyes blue.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
Penny, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: side-effects: dry eye, uveitis, retinal detachment.Please, forbid this drug!

column2: Peter, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: High eye-pressure 28/26 was reduced to 24/23,severe side-effects: uveitis, pain, macula edema, loss of vision 67%.Don't use this drug!!!

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
mary, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: pressure went only down from 26 to 25,side-effects: severe uveitis, macula edema, permanent loss of vision (from 98% to 21%), this drug should be forbidden!
